title: What is the ratio of 10 feet to 30 inches? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, you need the units to be the same for both values; ‘feet’ or ‘inches’, it doesn’t matter. For example, there are 12 inches in 1 foot. So restate the problem: 10 feet/30 inches is the same as (10 feet x 12 inches/foot) / 30 inches, which simplifies to (120 inches / 30 inches), or (4 inches/ 1 inch) Therefore, the ratio is 4:1 (Note that it works the other way, too: 30 inches x (1 foot / 12 inches) = 2.5 feet So the ratio (10 feet : 2.5 feet) still simplifies to 4:1
10 feet to 30 inches = 120 inches:30 inches = 120:30 = 4:1 —or— 10 feet to 30 inches = 10 feet to 2.5 feet = 10:2.5 = 4:1. Final Answer: Bananas
